paper_abstract: We study the power of Arthur-Merlin probabilistic proof systems in the data stream model. We show a canonical AM streaming algorithm for a class of data stream problems. The algorithm offers a tradeoff between the length of the proof and the space complexity that is needed to verify it. As an application, we give an AM streaming algorithm for the Distinct Elements problem. Given a data stream of length mover alphabet of size n, the algorithm uses (O) over tilde (s) space and a proof of size (O) over tilde (w), for every s, wsuch that s . w >= n(where (O) over tilde hides a polylog(m, n) factor). We also prove a lower bound, showing that every MA streaming algorithm for the Distinct Elements problem that uses s bits of space and a proof of size w, satisfies s . w = Omega(n). Furthermore, the lower bound also holds for approximating the number of distinct elements within a multiplicative factor of 1 +/- 1/ root n. As a part of the proof of the lower bound for the Distinct Elements problem, we show a new lower bound of O(v n) on the MA communication complexity of the Gap Hamming Distance problem, and prove its tightness.
